TextView.android:text: Charades are individual words in a clue which represent letters or words from the solution. The answer is formed by joining individually clued words to make a larger word. This is perhaps the most common cryptic device and you will come across charade clues in every cryptic crossword.
In the example above, 'Outlaw' is a charade for 'ban' and 'leader' is a charade for 'king'.
It is very common for charade clues to use a number of abbreviations or acronyms to construct the solution instead of using whole words. This is particularly common in more difficult crosswords.
'Ten' can be written as 'X' in roman numerals, and 'accident and emergency' can be abbreviated to 'A&E'. Putting these letters together gives us the solution 'AXE'
